title: Account for when a `ChannelPost` is returned from `SendMessage`
Upgrade all dependencies to stable tokio 0.2
body:
Hyper 0.13 (and Hyper-tls 0.4) stable was released 8 days ago, following tokio 0.2

I upgraded all alpha dependencies to stable.

* `tokio::timer` is now `tokio::time`
* `Timeout::new` no longer exists and has been replaced by the `timeout` function
* `timer::delay` now longer exists and has been replaced by `timer::delay_for`
* `hyper::client::Client` requires `Clone`, `Send`, and `Sync` for the Connector
* `hyper_tls::HttpsConnector::new` doesn't return a `Result` anymore
* `bytes::Bytes` v0.5 no longer implements `Extend<u8>`, the fix to aggregate the body is to use `hyper::body::to_bytes`
* `bytes::Bytes` doesn't copy the `&str` anymore in `From` implementation and requires an owned string instead

I also incremented the version of telegram-bot and telegram-bot-raw to `0.7.0`, and changed the toolchain to stable because beta is no longer needed.

title: Fix `cargo fmt` action.
body: Just an attempt to fix GitHub Action.

title: allow telegram bot to be built with rustls
Add ExportChatInviteLink API

- adds ExportChatInviteLink api

title: Set up GitHub Actions
body:
I think we can try actions without disabling travis builds for now.

It tests project with toolchain from `rust-toolchain` file, beta and nightly. It also checks formatting with rustfmt.

title: Sending files
body:
Based on #97. 

This PR introduce multipart support (thanks @shouya) and file sending API.

There are two primary types: `InputFileRef` (with `new` constructor which accepts URL and file id) and `InputFileUpload` (with constructors `with_path` and `with_data`).

See [usage example](https://github.com/telegram-rs/telegram-bot/blob/4d0629bff98df9b18d1467601585b979dae1a0f1/lib/examples/send.rs) and [request implementation example](https://github.com/telegram-rs/telegram-bot/blob/4d0629bff98df9b18d1467601585b979dae1a0f1/raw/src/requests/send_photo.rs) for details.

I'm not really sure it's best API but I think it's better than four (`send_path`, `send_data`,` send_url`, `send_file_id`) different methods. 

Fixes #111, #84.

title: Add missing InlineQueryResult types
body:
Resolves #121 .

I left the builder for `InlineQueryResultArticle` in to maintain backwards compatibility, but didn't add builders for the rest of `InlineQueryResult` types.

title: Tracing
body:
I think it could be very useful in debugging. Tracing should be explicitly enabled in executable.

[Tracing example](https://gist.github.com/knsd/73005e44aeab054ba5656d8ee0654a71)

Fixes #32.

title: Bump to 0.7.0-alpha.0 - Fix #102
body:
I'm thinking of releasing a `0.7.0-alpha.0` as now we have most of the unstable dependencies pinned to a released version and async/await is in the beta channel.

I think it would be good to address #138 before the stable `0.7.0` release though.

title: Add thumbnails to message file list as well
body: Apparently I forgot to return message thumbnails as files as well. These are indeed 'files' attached to the message to they should be returned.

title: Persistent connection
body:
* Remove unused dependecies: antidote, curl, tokio-curl. I think we are ready to drop curl connector.
* Use hyper-tls-0.4.0-alpha.4 instead of custom git reference
* Keep persistent connection to telegram server, it was broken in #131.

title: chore: update travis workflow
body:
- Test project with toolchain from `rust-toolchain` file.
- Build docs with toolchain from `rust-toolchain` file and upload to pages, fixes #143.
- Test project with stabe, beta and nightly toolchains.
- Temporary disable stable build since async is not in stable yet.

title: Add useful traits to easily get text or file properties from messages
body:
Fixes #144 

This implements the `MessageText` and `MessageGetFiles` traits to easily get text and file components from any message kind using `text()` and `get_files()`.

These traits have been implemented in a new `traits.rs` module, and are included in the prelude.
Please let me know if a different location, or different naming is desired.

Both traits currently return owned types, as I don't see a nice way of returning references for every type.

title: Updated README with master branch instability and scope of examples.
Updated hyper and futures-preview, pinned hyper-tls rev
body:
The current master didn't build. I've bumped the versions of the hyper and futures-preview crates and pinned the hyper-tls crate to the current git commit (They updated their hyper version which caused the current master to stop building).  
All tests ran successfully.

title: update tokio to 0.2.0-alpha.5 and hyper to alpha.2
body: I needed to enable the unstable-stream feature of hyper to compile telegram-bot. All tests pass
